result.execSummary:
The defendant Zachary J. Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Defendant Zachary J. Peterson in court with attorney John H. Wallace. Defendant Zachary J. Peterson in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Probation agent is also present.
Cases heard at this time are 15CF-234 and 15CF-439.

11:15 AM Court calls cases.
Court states appearances.

Defendant previously entered pleas, was found Guilty. Court ordered a PSI, one was prepared, copies forwarded to counsel. 
State has complied with victim notification statutes.

State has no corrections from a factual standpoint.
Defense has no corrections from a factual standpoint.

Neither counsel will be calling witnesses and there are no victims to make a statement.

Atty Constable makes sentencing recommendations.
State submits a restitution summary to the Court.

11:24 AM Atty Wallace makes sentencing recommendations.

11:30 AM Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.

11:33 AM Court has a number of factors to consider to determine sentencing.

15CF-234
Count 1:
Determinate Prison Sentence for 4 yrs
Initial Confinement of 1 yr  6 months
Extended Supervision of 2 yrs 6 months
Conditions:
No contact direct or indirect with Cindi Carrion
No contact with Gary Fix, Barbara Fix and/or Megan Bale
AODA assessment and comply with treatment recommendations
Comply with psychological treatment 
Continue to comply with any aftercare of that treatment
Comply with other assessments, treatments and programming as deemed appropriate by the  DOC
Sign releases of information  for DOC so they can monitor
All medications to be from one pharmacy
Do not possess or consume alcohol or be on premises where alcohol is served/sold as its primary business except within scope of your employment
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances
Obtain and maintain full time employment or schooling or a combination of both to equal full time
Pay court costs out of prison account at rate of 25%, balance to be paid on extended supervision
Pay v/w surcharges
Pay DNA Surcharge
Pay restitution of $264 to Megan Bale


15CF-439
Count 2:
Determinate Prison sentence for 2 years, consecutive to 15CF-234
Initial Confinement of 1 yr
Extended Supervision of 1 yr
208 days credit 
Conditions:
Comply with conditions as stated in 15CF-234
Pay court costs
Pay v/w surcharge
Pay DNA Surcharge



Count 3:
Jail sentence of 90 days concurrent to Ct 2 and concurrent to 15CF-234
Pay court costs
Pay v/w surcharge
Pay DNA Surcharge


Eligible for Earned Release
Eligible for Challenge Incarceration

Written determinate is given to Defendant
Parties will keep their copy of the PSI, are to be kept confidential.
original filed in 15CF234
Sentencing hearing on June 24, 2016 at 11:15 am.
Sentencing hearing on May 26, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant Zachary J Peterson in court with attorney John H. Wallace. Defendant Zachary J Peterson in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CF234 and 15CF439.

3:23 p.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Constable states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF234:
Count 1 - No contest
Count 2 - DRI

15CF439:
Count 1 - DRI
Count 2 - No contest
Count 3 - No contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
State has complied with victim notification and victim M. B. appears in court today.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1 of 15CF234 and Count 2 is DRI and guilty on Count 2 & 3 of 15CF439 and Count 1 is DRI.  Clerk directed to withhold entry of Judgment of Conviction this date.


BY THE COURT:
PSI ordered and copies to both parties no later than May 20, 2016
Sentencing scheduled for May 26, 2016 at 4 p.m.
Bond and conditions of bond are ordered continued.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 26, 2016 at 04:00 pm.

Defendant Zachary J. Peterson in court with attorney John H. Wallace. Defendant Zachary J. Peterson in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing.

Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for January 25, 2016 at 10:30 am.
